intro: Psoralea trinervata, commonly known as the three-veined psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has compound leaves with three nerves, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Psoralea trinervata is often found in grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
